Welcome to ‚ÄúMINDFUL MONDAY!‚Äù

Today, the Middleburgh counseling team is offering tips for teaching your kids mindful breathing. (It really works, try it!)

1. Set aside some time every day.
2. Have a special ‚Äúbreathing space.‚Äù
3. Make it fun.
4. Practice it yourself.
5. Include some props.
6. Offer some positive incentives.
7. Have your kids measure their feelings before and after
breathing.
8. Use when anyone‚Äôs feelings are on ‚Äúred‚Äù to calm down
back to ‚Äúgreen.‚Äù
9. Give lots of encouragement.

Today‚Äôs example: Circle breathing": Close your eyes and picture a big circle in your head. Start at the bottom of the circle and breathe in for three as you follow the circle up, breathe out for three as you follow the circle down. Repeat five to 10 times.
